@primalpoly @senatorshoshana No way. New Founding Fathers are strictly authoritarian rulers who have no tolerance for this "Federalism" nonsense. Naturally they'll invoke Lincoln constantly.

@catgpucela0124 @senatorshoshana @raylehmann This had better be in the next movie.

@jneeley78 @senatorshoshana This thread is making me realize I may have put to much thought into The Purge's political economy. Though not nearly as much as I have into pre-Imperial Star Wars. Wow am I a nerd.

@jneeley78 @senatorshoshana I always thought it was a Putin's Russia style state where you have elections but only one party can campaign, the government officials and the business elite are all the same people, free media exists but is widely censored and distrusted, etc.

@catgpucela0124 @senatorshoshana @raylehmann Is there a Purge EU I don't know about? Though it very technocratic to specify the types of weapons prohibited during the 12 hours of lawlessness. Michael Bloomberg would approve.
@catgpucela0124 @senatorshoshana @raylehmann Although, the unemployment rate is so low it was formerly thought impossible over a prolonged period! They're doing something right!

@catgpucela0124 @senatorshoshana @raylehmann I agree they're rich now. My big question is whether participating in the party got them rich (by nationalizing or otherwise expropriating corporate wealth) or if it's a 21st century business plot with social Darwinism thrown in.

@catgpucela0124 @senatorshoshana @raylehmann I get that, especially with Purge 1's yuppie anxiety metaphors. Not sure about the political economy of New Founding Father's America though. Are the "rich" just clients of the ruling party or is there still a market economy?

@jneeley78 @senatorshoshana Plus the status of post-Purge America in the international order is unclear. Are we a pariah a la Apartheid South Africa? Or do other countries have similar purges and a UN treaty to resolve these problems?
@catgpucela0124 @senatorshoshana @raylehmann Does the Purge have political parties? I always assumed it was a Russia-style "elections but no choice" fake democracy.
@diana_prichard But with more faux-futuristic diodes and blinking control panels.

@raylehmann @senatorshoshana The next Purge movie is a highbrow spinoff set in a fortified boardroom where hedge fund magnates monitor mercenaries sent to kill these targets while debating the morality of post-Purge vs pre-Purge capitalism.
